main event: Observers spotted a single unusual bright white object with a dull grey or white edge that moved erratically and changed directions abruptly in Minneapolis, Minnesota on April 13, 1967.
interesting points: The object was about the size of a basketball and had an undulating or pulsating quality with a slight halo or aura around the edges.
The object moved erratically and changed directions rather abruptly, but did not make any sound.
The object was visible for several minutes before disappearing below the horizon.
The weather conditions were recorded, including wind direction and velocity, ceiling, and visibility.
Investigators could not find any other related sightings in their files.
sighted object: A single bright white object with dull grey/white edges
